newsitem.title: CANADA: Canadian AirCargo Q1 revenues rise.
newsitem.headline: Canadian AirCargo Q1 revenues rise.

text.p: Canadian AirCargo, the cargo division of Canadian Airlines International , generated revenues of C$54.3 million during the first quarter ended March 31, the airline said.
Revenues in the first quarter last year were $52.6 million.
Since the onset of its latest financial crisis last winter, Canadian has reorganized its overseas network, pulling out of France and Germany, while boosting serving to London and North Asia.

CAI president Kevin Benson said the carrier hopes to be profitable by 1998. That would be the first profitable year in a decade for Canada's second largest airline. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
